name: df-maxidl
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2
body: |- wceq(cmaxidl, cmpt(s0, crngo, crab(s1, cfv(cidl, cv(s0)), wa(wne(cv(s1), crn(cfv(c1st, cv(s0)))), wral(s2, cfv(cidl, cv(s0)), wi(wss(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wo(wceq(cv(s2), cv(s1)), wceq(cv(s2), crn(cfv(c1st, cv(s0)))))))))))
bodyPretty: ⊢ MaxIdl =(s0 ∈ RingOps ↦ { s1 ∈(Idl ` s0)|(s1 ≠ ran((1st ` s0))∧ ∀(s2 ∈(Idl ` s0),(s1 ⊆ s2 →(s2 = s1 ∨ s2 = ran((1st ` s0))))))})
comment: Define the class of maximal ideals of a ring ` R ` . A proper ideal is called maximal if it is maximal with respect to inclusion among proper ideals. (Contributed by Jeff Madsen, 5-Jan-2011.)
